H0.text: Paleontologists would be most concerned with technological developments in insect control.

H1.text: Archaeologists would be most concerned with technological developments in insect control.

H2.text: Agriculturists are the group most concerned with technological developments in insect control.

H3.text: Meteorologists are the group most concerned with technological developments in insect control.

A4.text: Other GMO crops used by growers include insect-resistant crops, which have a gene from the soil bacterium Bacillus thuringiensis (Bt), which produces a toxin specific to insects.

A5.text: The USDA began to research biological control in 1881; it instituted its first large program in 1905, searching Europe and Japan for natural enemies of the spongy moth and brown-tail moth, establishing parasitoids (such as solitary wasps) and predators of both pests in the US.
